creator: jleech@virtela.net
text:
Filters appear to be not applied correctly, if the servlet is a jsp-page.
E.G. below the fooFilter will be applied correctly to bar but not to foo.
Workaround is to use the <url-pattern> tag for the filter mapping for jsps.
Searched bug database, user and dev mailing lists, didn't find this anywhere.
I Apologize in advance if this is already a known bug or I'm doing something
dumb.

(web.xml)
<filter>
   <filter-name>fooFilter</filter-name>
   <filter-class>com.foo.FooFilter</filter-class>
</filter>

<filter-mapping>
   <filter-name>fooFilter</filter-name>
   <servlet-name>foo</servlet-name>
</filter-mapping>

<filter-mapping>
   <filter-name>fooFilter</filter-name>
   <servlet-name>bar</servlet-name>
</filter-mapping>

<servlet>
   <servlet-name>foo</servlet-name>
   <jsp-page>/foo.jsp<jsp-page>
</servlet>

<servlet>
   <servlet-name>bar</servlet-name>
   <servlet-class>com.foo.Bar</servlet-class>
</servlet>

The problem is that your foo.jsp "servlet" is mapped to nothing (the request
will be processed by the main Jasper servlet, which is mapped to *.jsp). This is
a common mistake.
creator: remm@apache.org
